intro: Ceropegia rangacharii, commonly known as the Indian arrowroot or the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in moist soil. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
